Brooklyn Historical Society
Crescendo Club scrapbook
Fee, Frank E.
2017.009
0.25 Linear Feet in two folders
1929-1934 The Crescendo Club was a women's glee club formed by Avrid Samuelson in 1928. The club included many Swedish-American members, and performed at a number of Swedish churches throughout Brooklyn. This collection consists of one scrapbook about the Crescendo Club, including concert announcements, programs, the organization's consitution, and newspaper clippings documenting the perfromance season of the club. A0143
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of one scrapbook about the Crescendo Club, a women's glee club formed by Avrid Samuelson in 1928. This scrapbook was compiled by member Bertha Doris Fee and extensively annotated by club historians Gertrude E. Carlson and Myra L. Streeter. The scrapbook includes concert announcements, programs, the organization's consitution, and newspaper clippings documenting the perfromance season of the club. This collection also a small number of loose items, including additional performance programs and clippings, as well as a newsletter.
Biographical / Historical
The Crescendo Club was a women's glee club formed by Avrid Samuelson in 1928. The club included many Swedish-American members, and performed at a number of Swedish churches throughout Brooklyn. This collection consists of one scrapbook about the Crescendo Club, which includes concert announcements, programs, the organization's consitution, and newspaper clippings documenting the perfromance season of the club.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Doanted by Frank E. Fee Jr. in 2017.
Processing Information
Materials were placed into acid free folders.
Conditions Governing Access
Open for research without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Crescendo Club scrapbook, 201.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Conditions Governing Use
The copyright status of this collection has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
